column4:
Apparently there's a lot of noise-- Looks like
we're about to get a big order.

column3:
いや、グリッテンの戦いは盛り上がったな
ついつい思い出してしまうよ
column4:
No, the battle of Gritten was exciting. I can't
help but reminisce about it.

column3:
犠牲は大きかったが――
けして無駄にはならない
俺はそう信じている
column4:
Sacrifices were made, but they were not in vain.
I believe that.

column3:
騎士団は欠員が補充されて
ほっとひと息だ
column4:
The Knights have filled the vacancy. It's a
relief.

column3:
そういえば最近あの子を見ないな
いつも元気な女の覚者だ
column4:
By the way, I haven't seen that girl recently.
She's always been an energetic Arisen.

column3:
そう、イリス――
騎士団の中でも人気があるんだ
column4: Yes, Iris is popular even among the knights.

column3:
ここのところオークもおとなしいな
ずっとこうだといいのだが――
column4:
The orcs have been quiet as of late, too. I wish
it could be like this all the time—

column3:
なんとか街を守り切ったが――
こんなに攻め込まれるとは前代未聞だ
column4:
Somehow we managed to protect the town, but it's
unheard of to be invaded like this.

column3:
戦況は一進一退という認識は
間違いのようだな
column4:
The perception that the war is going back and
forth seems to be wrong.

column3:
厳しい顔のレオを見たが――
何を始める気だ？
column4:
I saw Leo with a stern look on his face-- What
are you trying to start?

column3: これは見逃せないと思ってね――
column4:
I think this is something you can't miss, you
know...

column3:
近頃、騎士団に参加したい――
騎士になりたいという者が増えている
column4:
Recently, more and more people want to join the
Order—want to become knights.

column3:
頼もしいことのように思えるが
皆、危機を身近に感じているということでもある
いったい、これからどうなるんだろうな
column4:
It seems like a reliable thing to do, but it also
means that everyone is feeling the crisis close at
hand. I wonder what in the world is going to
happen now?

column3:
ミシアル様がひさしぶりに大階段を下りたと
うわさになっているぞ
column4:
Rumor has it that Mysial has descended the grand
staircase for the first time in a long time.

column3:
第二のアークにイリスが現れたってのは
本当なのか？
いったい何をしていたんだ？
column4:
Is it true that Iris appeared in the second Ark?
What on earth was she doing?

column3:
アークの破壊部隊が編成されるはずだから
わたしは志願するつもりだ
column4:
Since the Ark's destruction squad is supposed to
be formed, I'm going to volunteer.

column3:
うわさになっている覚者の討伐には
参加したくないからな
column4:
I don't want to participate in the rumored
subjugation of the Arisen.

column3:
わたしたちを責めたければ責めるがいい
しかし、街にほとんど被害はなかった
それは騎士団の奮闘によるものだ
column4:
You are free to blame us.
However, there was little damage to the city,
thanks to the efforts of the Knight Order.

column3:
巫女が連れ去られるのを黙って見ていた
わけではないんだ
column4:
I didn't just silently watch as the woman was
abducted.

column3:
ミシアルが自ら闇に身を投げ――
誘拐犯たるイリスはレオが討伐した
そのレオは神殿に戻っていない――
column4:
Mysial threw herself into darkness— Iris, the
kidnapper, was defeated by Leo. But Leo has not
returned to the temple—

column3:
ジョゼフとクラウスの意見は対立し――
白竜は相変わらずまどろみの中――
column4:
Joseph and Klaus have conflicting opinions - The
White Dragon remains in a deep slumber.

column3:
なあ、おれたちはこのままでいいのか？
どこで何をすればいいんだ？
column4:
Hey, are we okay just like this? Where should we
go, and what should we do?

column3:
騎士団長はレオが手を抜いたと主張している
ということは――
column4:
The leader of the knights claims that Leo slacked
off which means—

column3: はて、どういうことだ？
column4: Well, what is this all about?

column3:
レオとは戦いたくない
たとえ手加減されても俺は逃げる
column4:
I don't want to fight Leo. Even if he takes it
easy on me I'll run.

column3:
その代わり、見かけた魔物は片っ端から
切り捨ててやる
column4:
Arisen, I will cut down every monster I see in my
way.

column3:
最前線は譲ってやる
感謝するんだな
column4:
I'll give you the front line. You should be
thankful.

column3:
これまで幾つもの戦いがあったが――
騎士団と覚者がこれほど協力し合って
事にあたったことはなかったんじゃないかな
column4:
There have been many battles so far, but the
Knights and the Arisen cooperating like this, I
don't think it has ever happened before.

column3:
今この時、ここにいられることが
誇らしくてたまらないよ
column4: I'm so proud to be here at this moment.

column3:
ゲルト騎士団長と仲間たちを
よろしく頼んだぞ
column4:
I entrusted Gerd, the leader of the Knight Order,
and his comrades to you.

column3:
正直言って、覚者の中にあんたがいるのは
助かるよ
column4:
To be honest, it's reassuring that you're one of
the Arisen.

column3:
レオは嫌いじゃないけど、なんだか
やりにくくてさ
column4:
I don't dislike Leo, but somehow he's difficult
to work with.

column3: 最早、話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3:
相互理解など凡夫の夢――
愚かなことよ
column4:
Mutual understanding is an ordinary man's dream—
It's foolishness.

column3:
悔はない
いまは決意あるのみ
column4:
No regrets.
Now we just have to be determined.

column3: 動き始めたものは、止められない
column4:
Once something starts moving, it cannot be
stopped.

column3: これ以上、互いに何を得るというのだ
column4: What more do we have to gain from each other?

column3:
覚者――
いびつな存在だ
column4: Arisen - what a depressing existence.

column3:
錬金の術をもってしても時は戻せない
ならば――
過去を悔やむ時間など無駄だ
column4:
Even with the art of alchemy, time cannot be
reversed. If that is the case―― Regretting the
past is a waste of time.

column3:
戦うのであれば――
死を覚悟したまえ
column4:
If you fight--
be prepared to die.

column3:
ここを、全ての古きものの終の地としよう
そして新たに、世界を描き変えるのだ
column4:
Let this be the end of all that is old and let us
redraw the world anew!

column3:
同意など求めぬ
ただ受け入れたまえ、この浄化を
column4:
I don't ask for your consent. Just accept this
cleansing.

column3: ほう？　話したいというわけか
column4: Oh? So you want to talk, is that it?

column3:
おや――少々意外ではあるな
錬金を忌む世で育った君が
《アルケミスト》に興味を持つとはね
column4:
Well--it's somewhat surprising that you, who grew
up in a world that abhors alchemy, would be
interested in becoming an Alchemist.

column3:
正直に言って、興味本位は困る
これからのわたしの立場もあるからね
column4:
To be honest, I'm troubled by curiosity for
curiosity's sake. Because it also involves my
future position, you know.

column3:
加えて、思い違いをしてもらっては
やはり困るが――
column4:
In addition, if you could misunderstand, that
would still be troublesome...

column3:
いやいや、すまない
どうも警戒が先に立ってしまってね
column4:
No, no, I'm sorry. I was just being cautious,
that's all.

column3:
君なら問題ないだろう
課題さえ乗り越えてくれれば
喜んで指導させてもらうよ
column4:
If it's you, there should be no problem. As long
as you can overcome the challenges, I would be
happy to guide you.

column3:
ほほう――課題を乗り越えたのか
君は白竜がかつて封じた錬金術を
覚者でありながら、学ぼうというんだね
column4:
Oh, I see—have you overcome the challenge? You,
as an Arisen, wish to learn the alchemy that the
White Dragon once sealed away.

column3:
嬉しくもあり、危うくもあり――
だが君が選んだのなら
私はその選択を尊重するよ
column4:
With the same purpose, traveling with fellow
comrades and walking together. Well, isn't it
wonderful?

column3: では、《アルケミスト》として共に歩もう
column4: Well then, let's walk together as 'Alchemists.'

column3:
錬金術とはそもそも、人の論理を用い
人の為に導く学問
理との共存も、君ならできるかもしれないね
column4:
Alchemy is, in the first place, the study of
using human logic to guide people. You might be
able to coexist with reason, too.

column3:
なかなかどうして、覚えが早いな、君は
もう中等レベルの錬金術は十分に
使いこなせているようだね
column4:
You're quite remarkable, your ability to learn
quickly. It seems like you're already proficient
in intermediate level alchemy.

column3:
ならば、もう少し上級の技に手を出して
みてもいいかもしれない
こういう技だが、どうだい、やれそうかな？
column4:
In that case, you might consider delving into
more advanced techniques. How about this
technique? Do you think you can handle it?

column3:
ううむ、末恐ろしいな、君は
この短期間でこれほどまでに成長するとは
わたし、ディアマンテスでさえ――
――いや、やめておこう
column4:
Hmm, it's quite frightening how much you've grown
in such a short period of time. Even I, Diamantes-
No, let's not go there.

column3:
いいかね、錬金術は論理の結晶
自然なるものに、人為的に別の特性を
組み合わせ変化させる術だ
column4:
Listen, alchemy is the crystallization of logic.
It is the art of combining and transforming the
natural with artificial characteristics.

column3:
君の意思、君が紡いだ論理こそが
技の要となる、それを常に思い出し
これからの技に向きあいなさい
column4:
Your will, the logic you weave is the key to
technique.
Always remember that and face the future of your
art.

column3:
錬金術の中には、術の論理を戦いの技
として応用したものがある
自身の生命力を媒介に、物質を生成・変換し
組み変える技だ
column4:
Wow, you stink. You certainly smell the part,
Arisen, but it couldn't hurt to take a bath every
now and then.

column3:
《アルケミスト》として君が錬金術を学ぶ
なら、そちらの分野がいいだろう
column4: As an "alchemist", you should study alchemy.

column3:
溶命炉の力を見たのなら知っているとおり
命のエネルギーは人も魔も惹きつける
――あれに比べればもちろん、規模こそ小さいがね
column4:
If you have seen the power of the Furnace, as you
know,
the energy of life attracts both humans and
demons.
Of course, compared to that, it is small in
scale, but you know.

column3:
力の流れと理論を知り、意思によって自在に
操ることができれば、君が生成するエネルギーは
エリクシルと交わることで
敵を蝕む毒にも、友を守る薬にも変わるだろう
column4:
If you know the flow and theory of power, and can
manipulate it at will, the energy you generate
will intersect with the elixir and turn into a
poison that will weaken your enemies or a medicine
that will protect your friends.

column3:
錬金術を扱う上で、もっとも大切なことは
やはり、錬成物質とエリクシルの変換だろう
column4:
When dealing with alchemy, the most important
thing remains the transformation of alchemized
substances and elixirs.

column3:
エリクシルとは属性の性質そのもの
錬成物質はエリクシルと結合し発動
することで、様々な効果を帯びる
column4:
Elixirs are substances that combine with the
attributes themselves and activate, giving various
effects.

column3:
どの戦いでどのエリクシルを用いるかが
戦いの結果にも大きく影響するのだ
column4:
The choice of which Elixirs to use in each battle
greatly affects the outcome of the fight.

column3:
君は《アルケミスト》として学んでいるのだね
調子はどうだい？
術の仕組みが解ってくれば
おのずと慣れてくるだろう
column4:
You are studying as an Alchemist, right?
How are you doing?
Once you understand the mechanism of magic, You
will naturally get used to it.

column3:
――そうだね、ジョブレベル１８と
いったところだろうか
column4: --I'd say job level 18.

column3:
それくらい基礎を修めたなら
次の段階に進んでもいいだろう
column4:
If you have mastered the basics to that extent,
you can proceed to the next stage.

column3:
もっとも、その前に神殿で君の戦いぶりを
日頃見ているであろう者から
本当にアルケミストを続けるべきか
同意はもらっておいた方がいい
column4:
However, it would be wise to obtain the approval
of those who have been observing your battle
prowess at the temple before continuing as an
Alchemist.

column3:
君がアルケミストとしてさらなるものを求め
君の戦いぶりを見ている者も許すのであれば――
その時はわたしが直接手ほどきをしよう
column4:
If you, as an Alchemist, seek something even
greater.
And if those who witness your battles are willing
to forgive—
Then, I shall personally guide you.

column3:
ほほう――
君は白竜がかつて封じた錬金術を
覚者でありながら、究めようというんだね
column4:
Oh, I see— You, as an Arisen, wish to learn the
alchemy that the White Dragon once sealed away.

column3:
嬉しくもあり、危うくもあり――
だが君が選んだのなら
私はその選択を尊重するよ
column4:
With happiness and uncertainty intermingled--
But if that's what you've chosen,
I will respect your decision.

column3:
錬金術とはそもそも、人の論理を用い
人の為に導く学問
理との共存も、君ならできるかもしれないね
column4:
Alchemy is, in the first place, the study of
using human logic to guide people.
You might be able to coexist with reason, too.

column3:
さて、これまで君が学んできたものを基礎とすると
これから私が教えるのは応用編だな
さらに深く論理を知り、属性と物質の
精――エリクシルの本質に迫る
column4:
Well, based on what you have learned so far, what
I will teach you next is the advanced edition.
Delve deeper into logic, the essence of attributes
and materials, the essence of Elixirs.

column3:
その理解と転化、そして組み換えこそが
《アルケミスト》の理
column4:
And thus, understanding, transformation, and
recombination are the true essence of the
Alchemist's order.

column3:
さぁ、さっそく課題を出そう
君がその一端に触れてくれることを願うよ
column4:
Now, let's promptly submit the assignment. I hope
you can lend a hand in that regard.

column3:
ふむ、君のアルケミストとしての研鑽には
目を見張るものがある
十分応用を学べるレベルになっているようだね
column4:
Hmm, your dedication to studying as an Alchemist
is truly remarkable. It seems you have reached a
level where you can learn and apply skills
extensively.

column3:
もしも、君が錬金の道の奥深くへと
歩みを進めようというならば
わたしが直接手ほどきしたいところだが――
そうするべきかどうか、判断が難しい
column4:
If you are willing to take a step deeper into the
path of alchemy, I would love to teach you
directly--
but it's hard to decide if I should.

column3:
神殿で君の訓練や戦いぶりを見てきた者
が賛成するなら、わたしは構わないが
column4:
If those who have witnessed your training and
battles at the temple agree, I have no objections.

column3: なるほど、覚者か――
column4: I see, an Arisen, huh?

column3: 予断を許さない状況のようだね
column4:
It seems like a situation that doesn't allow for
any speculation.

column3:
君のことは気になるが――
余計な詮索は止めにしておこう――互いにね
column4:
I'm curious about you--
but let's not pry too much into each other's
affairs--we're both here for each other.

column3:
生きていればこんな体験ができる
ああ、やはり人生は素晴らしいね
column4:
If you are alive, you can have such experiences,
Ah, indeed life is wonderful.

column3: 過ぎたるは及ばざるがごとし、か
column4: Excessive is as bad as useless.

column3:
なぜ、こうなってしまったのか――
いつか明らかにしてみせよう
ああ、もちろん、楽しみで仕方がないよ
column4:
How did this happen--
I'll reveal it to you one day.
Oh, and of course, I'm looking forward to it!

column3:
あの日――黄金竜と白竜の戦い以来
我々が過ごしてきたこの時間を――
わたしが解き明かしてみせよう
column4:
Since that day - the battle between the Golden
Dragon and hours.
This time we have spent, I will unravel it for
you.

column3:
過ちは、誰にでもある
それを正す勇気こそ、尊いのだ
column4:
Everyone makes mistakes. It is the courage to
correct them that is precious.

column3:
すべてを知りつくしたつもりでも
まだこうして予測不能な出来事が起こる
うれしくもあり――恐ろしくもあり――だね
column4:
Even if you think you know everything, unexpected
events can still happen. It's both exciting and
terrifying, isn't it?

column3: ああ、クラウスの友達か、どうしたんだい？
column4: Ah, Klaus's friend, what's up?

column3:
錬金術師が始めたことは
錬金術師が終わらせる
column4:
What the alchemist started, the alchemist will
finish.

column3: それが我々の覚悟だ
column4: That is our Arisen's resolve.

column3: ディアマンテスは錬金術師の面汚し――
column4: Diamantes is a disgrace to the alchemists.

column3:
奴を倒せる日が来ようとは
ああ、堪え忍んだ甲斐があったというものだ
column4:
I never thought I'd see the day he'd be defeated.
Oh, it's been worth it.

column3:
神殿の連中によろしく伝えてくれ
心の準備ができたら、わたしの方から
挨拶に行きたいと思う
column4:
Please convey my regards to the temple personnel.
Once I am mentally prepared, I would like to go
and greet them.

column3: さあ、今は早く帰った方がいい
column4: Now, it's better to go home quickly.

column3:
ああ、その話だな
いいだろう
column4: Ah, that story, right? That's fine.

column3:
立場上、ひいきするわけにはいかないが
私が最も愛するジョブは当然《ファイター》だ
column4:
On principle, I cannot show favoritism, but my
most beloved job is, of course, "Fighter."

column3:
己が身を敵前にさらし、盾と剣を巧みに操り
それはまるで舞の如く――
column4:
Exposing oneself to the enemy and deftly wielding
shield and sword. It's like a dance—.

column3:
突破口を開いて敵陣深く入り込み
本陣をかく乱する――
ふふ、敵が驚き、呆ける顔を間近で見られるのは
《ファイター》だけだ！
column4:
Opening a breakthrough and infiltrating deep into
enemy territory
Disrupting their main force -
Hehe, being able to see the surprised and
bewildered faces up close
Is something only a Fighter can do!

column3:
おまえもなかなか腕を上げ、《ファイター》と
しての自覚を身に付けつつあるようだな
column4:
You have also been improving quite a bit and seem
to be gaining a sense of being a Fighter.

column3:
――よし、私から修練を課してやろう
そして今以上に技を磨き、一流の剣士となれ！
column4:
Alright, I will impose training upon you And
thus, polish your skills even more, become a
first-class swordsman!

column3:
よし、いいだろう
《ファイター》を名乗ることを許そう
column4:
Okay, fine. I'll allow you to call yourself a
Fighter.

column3:
まぁいい
新たな剣技を教えてやる
column4:
Well, never mind. I will teach you a new sword
technique.

column3:
今以上に強くなりたければ、修練を重ね
さらに技を会得するのだな
column4:
If you want to become stronger than you are now,
train harder and further hone your skills.

column3:
ほう――、かなり腕を上げたようだな
今のおまえなら、あの技も使い
こなせるだろう
column4:
Well, you've really improved your skills, haven't
you?
With your current ability, you should be able to
use that technique and master it.

column3:
剣の役割とは相手を斬ること
だが、それは道具としての役目であって
剣の本質ではない
column4:
The role of a sword is to slash the opponent.
However, that is only its function as a tool.
It is not the essence of a sword.

column3:
敵を削ぎ己を活かす
それこそが本質だ
勝敗、生死は全て、その結果
付いてくるものにすぎない
column4:
Reduce your enemy and make the most of yourself;
That's the essence.
Winning and losing, life and death, are all just
the result of what comes with it.

column3: それを心に留め、この技を修得するがいい
column4:
Remember that in your heart, you should strive to
master this technique.

column3:
知っての通り《ファイター》の武器は剣と盾
そして己自身の肉体だ
column4:
As you know, the weapon of a Fighter is a sword
and a shield and their own body.

column3:
敵を討つ、それがファイターに課された最大の
役割だが、ただ攻撃をすればよいというわけではない
自身を守り、先陣に居続けることが仲間を救い
ひいては勝利につながるのだ
column4:
The greatest role imposed on a Fighter is to
defeat enemies, but it's not simply about
attacking. Protecting oneself and staying at the
forefront can save comrades and ultimately lead to
victory.

column3:
攻守どちらをおろそかにしても、一流のファイター
とは言えないというわけだ
column4:
Regardless of whether you neglect offense or
defense, it means that you cannot be called a
first-class Fighter.

column3:
敵と斬り結ぶ中、技術は後からでも付いてくる
ファイターとなるなら、まずは剣と盾が身体の一部と
思えるようになるまで振るい、感覚をなじませろ
column4:
With cutting with the enemy, the skill comes
later.
If you want to be a fighter, first swing your
sword and shield until you feel like they are part
of your body
and familiarize yourself with them.

column3:
それ以上のことは、おまえが一人前のファイターに
なった頃に教えてやる
column4:
I will teach you more when you become a
full-fledged Fighter.

column3:
盾は、身を守るだけのものではないぞ
使いようによっては敵の攻撃をいなし
反撃の足掛かりとすることもできる
column4:
The shield is not just for self-defense.
Depending on how it is used, it can block the
enemy's attacks and serve as a foothold for
counterattacks.

column3:
攻撃を受ける直前、敵の体重がかかる
わずかな瞬間を見定めろ
column4:
Just before receiving an attack, determine the
moment when the enemy's weight is applied.

column3:
そこを捉えれば反動はそっくり相手に
返り、態勢を崩すことができるだろう
column4:
If you seize that moment, the recoil will be
completely returned to the opponent
, and you will be able to disrupt their stance.

column3:
《クリティカルタイミング》――
ちまたではそんな呼び方をしているらしい
覚えておくことだ
column4:
《Critical Timing》――
It seems that is what they call it.
Remember that.

column3:
ほう――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
column4: Oh... Do you want me to teach you a lesson?

column3:
なら少なくとも《ファイター》となり
ジョブレベル１８以上の経験を
積むことだな
column4:
Then, let us send you to the past. Oh, Arisen of
the White Dragon, may fortune favor you.

column3:
その後、訓練官レンテンの許可が
出たなら考えてやろう
話はそれからだ
column4:
After that, I'll think about it if the Training
Officer Renton gives the green light. Then we'll
talk about it.

column3:
あぁ――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
なるほど確かに相応の腕になったようだ
column4:
Oh—you want me to train you? Well, you certainly
look like you're up to snuff.

column3:
だが何事にも順序がある
まずは神殿の訓練官レンテンに
ジョブの基本を修めた報告くらいはしてこい
column4:
But there's an order to everything.
First, you should at least report to Lenten, the
temple trainer,
that you've mastered the basics of the job.

column3:
正式に教えを請いにきたならば
稽古に付き合ってやろう
column4:
If you have come to formally seek knowledge,
I shall accompany you in your training.

column3:
戦術を指南してほしいのか？
ならば実戦に勝る教えはないぞ
column4:
You want me to teach you tactics? Then there's no
better way to learn than through combat.

column3:
戦いは勝つためにするのだ
そのための努力、怠るな
column4:
We fight in order to win. Do not neglect the
effort required for that.

column3:
すまないな
世間話というものが苦手なんだ
column4:
I'm sorry,
but I'm not good at small talk

column3:
集中だ！
戦闘態勢は寝所でも解くな！
column4:
Concentration! Don't let your guard down even in
your sleeping quarters!

column3:
覚者とは何か――
いろいろな考えがあるだろうが
自分は、戦人（いくさびと）だと信じている
column4:
What is an Arisen? There may be various thoughts,
but I believe I am a warrior.

column3:
こう戦闘続きでは疲れもたまるな――
キノザでゆっくりしたいものだ
column4:
I'm getting tired after all these battles-- I'd
like to relax in Kinoza.

column3:
魔物より恐ろしい敵の名を教えてやろう
それは――油断、慢心、怠慢だ
column4:
I will teach you the name of an enemy more
frightening than monsters. It is--carelessness,
complacency, and negligence.

column3:
どれほどの敵を倒せば
この地に平穏が訪れるのか――
こんなことを思うとは――老いたか
column4:
How many enemies must I defeat for peace to come
to this land? To think such a thing... have I
grown old?

column3:
勝利の秘策？
そんなものがあるなら、そもそも戦争など起こらない
column4:
The secret strategy for victory? If such a thing
exists, wars wouldn't happen in the first place.

column3:
価値を問う前に、黙って守れ
失って後悔したくなければな
column4:
Before you question the value, shut up and
protect unless you want to lose it and regret it.

column3: 何？　拠点防衛に関する提案？
column4: What? A proposal regarding base defense?

column3:
オークどもをぶっ倒し、追いだしても
臭いはしばらく残るんだ
たまらん――くそっ！
column4:
Even if you knock the orcs off and drive them out
the smell lingers for a while. I can't stand it --
damn it!

column3: 魔物掃除に来たのか？
column4: Did you come to exterminate the enemy?

column3:
だったら遠慮はいらない
砦の外でひと暴れしてきてくれ
column4:
Then you should at least become a 《Fighter》 and
have at least 18 job levels of experience.

column3:
アルヴァーと会ったらしいな
だったら、こんなところにいないで
さっさと契約をすませたらどうだ？
column4:
I heard you met Alvar. If that's the case, why
don't you finish the contract quickly? You
shouldn't be here instead.

column3:
どうした？
レオの話し相手は退屈か？
column4: What's the matter? Bored of talking to Leo?

column3:
だったら遠慮することはない
思う存分魔物と戦ってくれ
column4:
In that case, there's no need to hold back. Fight
monsters to your heart's content.

column3: おや――また来たのか
column4: Oh, you've come back again.

column3:
ひまだと言うなら、遠慮はいらない
このあたりの魔物を片っ端から倒してくれ
まったくどこからわいてくるのやら――だな
column4:
If you say you have free time, there's no need to
hold back.
Please defeat all the enemies around here one by
one.
I wonder where they're coming from.

column3:
オークどもの行動様式が明らかに変化している
そちらも警戒を怠るなとレオとゲルト団長に
伝えてくれ
column4:
The behavior patterns of the Orcs have clearly
changed. Please also inform Captain Leo and Gerd
to stay alert.

column3:
アークとやらが出現してから
オークの様子がおかしい――
column4: Since The Ark appeared, the Orcs seem strange.

column3: そう感じたのは自分の勘違いか――
column4: Did I misunderstand it -

column3: 神殿の様子はどうだ？
column4: How is the temple?

column3:
ひまそうな覚者がいたら
訓練がてら顔を出すように伝えてくれ
column4:
If there are any idle Arisen, please tell them to
come and train with me as a practice session.

column3:
そう焦るな
まずはレオ統率と話してからだ
column4:
Don't rush like that. First, talk to Leo for
guidance.

column3:
モゴックの様子を覚えているか？
あいつが持っていたものは――なんだ？
column4:
Do you remember what Mogok looked like? What that
guy had--what was it?

column3:
オークはズールとかいう魔物と手を組んだ
このところ感じていた違和感の正体は
それだったようだ
column4:
The Orc has formed an alliance with a creature
called Zuhl. The true identity of the discomfort I
had been feeling lately seems to be that.

column3:
わたしはバカなオークと毎日戦っているのが
嫌いじゃなかった
正直、生きている実感があった
column4:
I didn't mind fighting against stupid orcs every
day. Honestly, it made me feel alive.

column3:
ところがあのズールがオークを変えてしまった
小賢しい――薄汚い魔物め――
もう憎しみしかない
column4:
However, that Zuhl changed the orcs into a
cunning, filthy enemy... There is only hatred
left.

column3:
憎しみを抱えながら戦うのは――
きっと悲しいぞ？
だが、これからはそういう時代なのかもな
column4:
Fighting with hate-- sure is sad, isn't it? But
maybe that's the way it's going to be from now on.

column3:
イリスに会ったらたまには顔を出すように
伝えてくれ
column4:
If you meet Iris, please tell her to show her
face once in a while.

column3: もしやおまえはわたしと同類ではないのか？
column4: Are you not like me?

column3:
小ぎれいな神殿よりも最前線の砦が好き――
着飾った街の住人よりも
薄汚れた鎧カブトの戦士を愛おしく思う――
column4:
I prefer the frontline fortress over the tidy
temple――
I cherish the dirty armored soldier more than the
well-dressed residents of the city――

column3: ならば遠慮せず、いつでもここに来い
column4:
Then you don't need to hold back. Please go wild
outside the fortress.

column3: 不覚だ――面目ない――
column4: I am not Arisen - I am ashamed -

column3:
しかし、案ずるな
わたしはもう未来を見ている
もうオークの好きにはさせないさ
column4:
But don't fret.
I've already seen the future.
I won't let the orcs have their way anymore.

column3:
神殿はどうだ？
ここの体制の立て直しが一段落ついたら
顔を出そうと思っているんだ
column4:
How's the temple going? I'm thinking of showing
up when I'm done rebuilding this place.

column3: うわさでは神殿の雰囲気が変わったのだとか
column4:
Rumor has it that the atmosphere of the temple
has changed.

column3:
悲壮感に満ちているらしいな
正直、行く気が失せる
column4:
It seems filled with a sense of tragedy.
Honestly, I lose my motivation to go.

column3:
ここにいても白竜の目覚めは感じられるんだ
だから、わたしもおまえと同じ時に
竜力を受け取っている
column4:
I can feel the awakening of the White Dragon even
here.
So I also receive Dragon Force at the same time
as you.

column3:
そして、その恩に報いることを考える
ああ――いつも考えている
column4:
And think about repaying the favor.
Oh--I think about it all the time!

column3:
ミシアルが謁見の間から出たらしいな
もっと引っ張り出してやるといい
column4:
Mysial seems to have come out of the Audience
Chamber. It would be good to get them out even
more.

column3:
――いや、誘っても無理か
――うん、無理だな
column4:
――No, it would be impossible to invite her.
――Yeah, it's impossible.

column3:
最前線だったこの砦も
今では時折小競り合いが起こる程度だ
column4:
This fort, which used to be the front line,
now sees only occasional skirmishes.

column3:
殺気で肌がヒリヒリ傷むような戦場――
そんな場所を探して旅に出ようか
――最近、そんなことを思うんだ
column4:
A battlefield where the skin stings with a
killing intent - Should I search for such a place
and embark on a journey? Lately, I've been
thinking about such things.

column3:
イリスの行方を知っているか？
身を隠すように言ってやった方が
いいかもしれないぞ？
column4:
Do you know where Iris is? It might be better to
tell her to hide.

column3:
ふん――そうか
さすがレオだ
column4: Hmph――so that's it. As expected of Leo.

column3:
神殿が大変だと聞いているが――
おまえは戻った方が良くはないか？
column4:
I heard that the temple is in trouble— Wouldn't
it be better for you to come back?

column3: ここの指揮は部下に任せようと思う
column4:
I think I'll leave the command here to my
subordinates.

column3:
引き継ぎが終わり次第わたしも神殿へ行く
向こうで会おうではないか
column4:
Once the handover is complete, I will also go to
the temple.
Let's meet there, shall we?

column3:
レオのことは心配するな
すべて良かれと思ってしていることだろう
column4:
Don't worry about Leo. I'm sure he's doing
everything for the best.

column3: 行動が愚かだが――昔からだ
column4:
My actions may be foolish, but it has always been
this way.

column3:
くそっ――
このあたりの魔物が騒がしくなってな
なかなか離れることができないのだ
column4:
Damn it―― The enemies around here are getting
noisy. I can't seem to get away easily.

column3:
ここにはわたしがいる
――わかるか？
column4: Here I am --you know what I mean?

column3:
ここの守りは堅い――そういうことだ
思う存分、戦ってこい
column4:
The defense here is strong—That's what I'm
talking about. Go ahead and fight to your heart's
content.

column3:
報せを聞いて駆けつけたぞ
おまえは最前線にいたのだろう？
ご苦労だったな
column4:
I rushed over upon hearing the report. Were you
at the front line? You've worked hard.

column3:
今度手柄話を聞かせてくれ
盛大にうらやましがってやろう
column4:
Tell me your achievements next time. I'll
celebrate them with great envy.

column3:
ん？
俺と仲良くなりたいっての？
column4: Hmm? You want to be friends with me?

column3:
世間話ねえ
そんな気分じゃないんだよな――
column4: Chatting is not on my mind right now—

column3:
なああんた、ひまなら俺と――
あ、ひまじゃない？　そりゃ失礼
column4:
Hey, if you're free, how about spending some time
with me... Oh, you're not? Well, that was rude.

column3:
自由に生きるってのは
思ったほど楽じゃないんだな、これが
column4:
Living free is not as easy as I thought it would
be.

column3:
あんた、この世界がどうなるのが理想？
なーんて、俺も考えたことないけどな
column4:
What would you like the world to be like?
I've never really thought about it.

column3:
苦難の時代だなんて言うやつもいるけど
俺は結構楽しんでるよ
column4:
Some say it's a hard time. I'm having a pretty
good time.

column3:
まいったまいった――
次から次へと魔物がよぉ
column4:
I'm in trouble, I'm in trouble--
Enemies keep coming one after another.

column3:
覚者のことを便利屋みたいに
思ってる奴、いるよな――
column4:
There are people who think of Arisen as a
handyman, right?

column3:
俺、聞き流すの得意でさ――
それでもいいなら、どうぞ
――さあ、話せ！
column4:
I'm good at just listening, you know-- If that's
really okay, then go ahead. Now, speak up!

column3:
昨日と違う今日、今日と違う明日――
世界はその繰り返しでできてるんだ
――てな
column4:
Today is different from yesterday, and tomorrow
will be different from today―― The world is made
up of such repetitions ―― That's what it means.

column3:
一期一会――いい言葉だね
俺、商品、客――
すべての出会いが、そうなんだな
column4:
Once-in-a-lifetime encounter――That's a nice phrase
Me, the product, the client――
Every encounter is like that

column3:
あんたもいっぱしの覚者を気取るなら
身につけるモノは厳選しなよ
どうだい、ひとつ見繕ってやろうか？
column4:
If you're going to pretend to be an Arisen, be
selective about what you wear. How about I pick
something for you?

column3:
こんな時代なのに商品が行き来しているのは
凄いことだ――
俺たち、誇っていいと思うぞ
column4:
It's amazing how much product is coming and going
in these times-- I think we should all be proud!

column3:
金なら、余ってるんじゃないのか？
安くするぜ、取引していきなよ
column4:
I'm sure you've got plenty of money. I'll give
you a discount. Make a deal with me.

column3: よぉ、調子はどうだ？
column4: Hey, how are you doing?

column3:
その臭い――戦う覚者という感じで
悪くはないが、日常も大切にな
column4:
Wow, you stink. You certainly smell the part,
Arisen, but it couldn't hurt to take a bath every
now and then.

column3:
時間があるなら世のため人のために
駆け回るのも悪くないぞ
金にもなるしな
column4:
If you have time, it's not a bad idea to run
around for the sake of the world and for others.
It can even bring you money as well.

column3:
いろんな覚者がいる
いろんな生き方がある
とても自然なことだと思うね
column4:
There are various Arisen.
There are various ways of living.
I think it's a very natural thing.

column3:
へえ――なんだか見違えたな
一皮むけたってやつだ
column4:
Oh, wow—something about you has really changed.
It's like you've shed a whole new skin.

column3:
珍しいものを見つけたら声をかけてくれよな
場合によっては高値で引き取って
やれるかもしれないぜ？
column4:
If you find something rare, please let me know.
Depending on the situation, I might be able to
take it off your hands for a high price, you know?

column3:
アークでは、いや、参った――
でも、探せば珍品があったかもな
column4:
The Ark, no, I give up—But if you look, there
might be rare items.

column3:
遠出したのか？
このあたりにはない花とか素材とか――
column4:
Did you go far? Maybe you found flowers or
materials that aren't found around here.

column3:
損をすることはないから
目についたら持ち帰るといい
column4:
You've got nothing to lose, so take it home if
you see it.

column3:
戦っても空しい――金を儲けても空しい――
だが、どんな時でも続く覚者人生――
楽しまなくちゃ損だぜ？
column4:
Even if you fight, it's in vain―― even if you
make money, it's in vain―― But the life of the
Arisen continues no matter what―― You have to
enjoy it, or else it's a loss, you know?

column3:
心配してくれる友達がいるなんて幸せ者だ
――イリスがそれを忘れていなければ
何も問題は起こらないさ
column4:
I am a lucky person to have friends who worry
about me. - As long as Iris doesn't forget that,
nothing will go wrong.

column3:
謁見の間の様子はどうだ？
俺はしばらく距離を置くことにするよ
column4:
How is the situation in the Audience Chamber? I'm
going to keep my distance for a while.

column3:
凄いことが始まるらしいな
ひさしぶりに大階段を登ろうか――
column4:
I hear great things are about to begin. Let's
climb the grand staircase for the first time in a
while—

column3:
戦うだけが覚者じゃない――
とはいえ、かつてないほど戦いの機運が
盛りあがっている――
column4:
Being an Arisen is not just about fighting--
However, the momentum for battle has never been
higher--

column3: どんな立ち位置をとるべきか――悩むね
column4: I'm not sure what position I should take.

column3: イリスの顔を見ないけど何か知ってるか？
column4: I don't see Iris around, do you know anything?

column3:
イリスのことは聞いた
友達ではあるが――
column4: I heard about Iris. She is a friend, but - -

column3:
彼女との付き合いが長い
レオに任せるのが一番だな
column4:
It'd be best to leave it to Leo, who has a long
history with her.

column3:
これまでになかったことが立て続けに起こると
何に対しても集中できなくなる
我ながら修行が足りないぜ
column4:
When unprecedented events continue to occur, I
cannot concentrate on anything.
I am lacking in self-discipline!

column3: 長命のエルフが持つ知識は値千金――
column4:
The knowledge that long-lived Elves possess is
invaluable.

column3:
なんてな
損得抜きで、仲良くしたかった
column4:
What a pity.
I wanted to get along with you, no gain or loss.

column3:
白竜が元気だったら、俺は覚者じゃなかった
たとえエルフが死のうが――
なんとも思わなかっただろう
column4:
If the white dragon had been healthy, I wouldn't
have been an Arisen. Even if the elf had died— I
wouldn't have cared.

column3: ――人生の巡り合わせは不思議だよな
column4: Life's encounters are strange, aren't they?

column3:
新たなアーク――
ほとぼりがさめたら個人的に調査もいいな
column4:
A new Ark... It would be nice to personally
investigate once the heat dies down.

column3:
見たぞ――
巫女と歩くなんてどんな気分だ？
column4:
I saw it-- How does it feel to walk with a
priestess?

column3: 覚者のことは覚者が始末をつける――
column4:
The Arisen has to take care of the Arisen's
business.

column3:
昔からの習慣だ
覚悟だけはしておこう
column4: It's an old habit. Let's just be prepared.

column3:
しばらくここにいる
同志に向ける武器は持っていないからな
column4:
I'll be here for a while, as I don't have any
weapons to aim at comrades.

column3: 同志に向ける武器はない――
column4: There are no weapons for comrades-in-arms -

column3:
甘いことを言っている場合じゃないのか
くそっ！
column4: You can't be so naive. Damn!

column3: 《謁見の間》はどんな様子だ？
column4: What's going on in the audience chamber?

column3:
さぞ――いや、やめておこう
想像が当たったところでうれしくもなんともない
column4:
Surely - No, let's leave it. Even if my
imagination was correct, it wouldn't make me
happy.

column3:
みんな遠征に夢中になっているようだが
ここの安全が保証されたわけではあるまい？
column4:
Everyone seems to be preoccupied with the
expedition. How can we be assured of the safety of
this place?

column3:
というわけで、こんな言い方はらしくないが――
俺に任せてくれ
column4:
So, although it may not be the most appropriate
way to say it—Leave it to me.

column3:
メルゴダの様子はどうなんだ？
戦いで忙しいかもしれないが
逸品珍品を見逃すなよ？
column4:
How's it going in Mergoda? You may be busy
fighting the battle, but don't miss the gems and
curiosities, okay?

column3:
結局これは過去との戦いだったというわけか――
いや、ずっと続いていたわけだから
まだ過去にはなっていない――
column4:
In the end, this was a battle with the past, so
to speak―― No, because it has been continuing for
a long time, it has not become the past yet――

column3:
面倒だな――おまえの手で
過去にしてやるといい
column4:
It's troublesome... It would be good for you to
make a thing of the past with your own hands.

column3:
あちこちで言われて聞き飽きただろうが
俺からも言わせてくれ
column4:
You must have heard it said everywhere by now.
But let me say it too.

column3:
逞しくなったな――貫禄すら漂うよ
さあ、報告があるんだろう？
早くすませて土産話を聞かせてくれ
column4:
You've grown strong—even dignified. Now, you have
a report to give, don't you? Get it over with and
tell me about your souvenirs.

column3: 呑ませてくれ――
column4: Let me drink—

column3:
今は呑んで――呑んで――
明日からちゃんとするからさ
column4:
Right now, I'm drinking - drinking - I'll
properly do it starting from tomorrow.

column3: ブ、ブラッドオーブ――探さなくちゃ――
column4: B-Blood Orb... I have to find it...

column3:
俺はここで白竜様と倒れた覚者のために
やれることをやるよ
column4:
I will do what I can here for the Arisen who fell
with the White Dragon.

column3: あんたたち、黒騎士を頼むぞ
column4: I entrust you with the Black Knight.

column3:
一時はどうなることかと思ったよ
もしあのまま――
column4:
For a moment, I thought I was done for. If things
had stayed that way -

column3:
――やーめた！　楽しいことだけ
考えるわ
column4: - Never mind! Just think about the fun parts.

column3:
ふう――覚者でいることは大変だけど
お互い、がんばりましょう
column4:
Phew - being an Arisen is tough, but
we both just have to do our best.

column3:
遠くへ行きたいのよ
誰も行ったことがない地へね
column4:
I want to go far away. To a place no one has ever
been before.

column3:
覚者っぽくないって言われるけど――
やっぱり、わかっちゃうよね
column4:
I'm told that I don't seem like an Arisen, but...
I still understand, you know.

column3:
覚者だからって戦いばかりの人は
正直、どうかと思うな
column4:
A person who only seeks constant battles just
because they are an Arisen, honestly, I think
that's questionable.

column3:
レスタニア中のきれいな風景を見たいけど
そういう場所は魔物が集まりがちだよね
column4:
I want to see the beautiful scenery throughout
Lestania, but those kinds of places tend to
attract enemies.

column3:
魔物を倒したら
白竜様が毎回ほめてくれる――
そんなのだったら、やりがいあると思わない？
column4:
If you defeat the enemy,
the White Dragon will praise you every time--
If that's the case, don't you think it's
rewarding?

column3:
ごきげんよう
さあ、今日はどこへ行こうかな
column4: Hello. Well, where shall we go today?

column3:
覚者って――孤独よね
普通の人だった頃が懐かしい
――なんてね
column4:
Being Arisen -- it's lonely, isn't it? I miss the
time when I was just a normal person. -- Just
kidding!

column3:
覚者の気持ちは覚者にしかわからない
そう思っていたけど――
覚者同士でもわからないこと多いよね
column4:
The feelings of an Arisen can only be understood
by another Arisen, or so I thought... But even
among Arisen, there are many things we don't
understand.

column3:
本当なら覚者は世界にひとりしか存在しない
そんな話を聞いたことがあるの
だったら――これからどうなるんだろうな
column4:
In reality, there should only be one Arisen in
the world Have you ever heard such a story? If
so... what will happen from now on?

column3:
隊長、見てこの腕と足の筋肉！
シュッとして、かっこいいと思わない？
column4:
Captain, look at these arm and leg muscles! Don't
you think they look so cool and shapely?

column3:
最近、やたらと声をかけられるんだけど――
わたしも結構名の売れた覚者になったってこと！？
column4:
Lately, I've been getting a lot of attention and
being approached a lot. Does that mean I've become
quite a renowned Arisen?!

column3:
例えば、ヴァネッサなんて
覚者としても女性としてもひとつの理想型でしょ？
column4:
For example, someone like Vanessa, isn't she an
ideal type both as an Arisen and as a woman?

column3: だからわたしは、あえてそこは目指さないの
column4: So, I intentionally won't aim for that.

column3: 覚者になったことを嘆く気持ちが前はあったけど――
column4:
I used to feel regret about becoming an Arisen,
but...

column3:
今は天職って感じ
ま、仕事じゃないけどね
column4:
It feels like my calling from heaven now. Well,
it's not really a job though.

column3: あら、ごきげんよう
column4: Oh, good day.

column3:
こうして一気に神殿の中枢に食い込めるなんて
ジョゼフ様々！
column4:
I can't believe that we can be in the heart of
the temple all at once like this. Thank you
Joseph!

column3: 精一杯頑張るから、隊長、ひいきしてよね？
column4:
I'll do my best, captain, and you'll patronize
me, right?

column3:
みんなセシリーセシリーって
どうかしちゃったみたい
column4: Everyone seems to be obsessed with Cecily, Cecily.

column3:
まあ、気持ちはわかるけどね
わたしだって、なんとかしてあげたいもの
column4:
Well, I can understand their feelings. I also
want to do something to help.

column3:
時には強く言わないとね
もうお客さんじゃなくて、仲間なんだから
ダメなものはダメ
column4:
Sometimes you have to say it strongly. You're not
a customer anymore, you're a friend. What doesn't
work doesn't work.

column3: あ、セシリーの話ね
column4: Ah, it's about Cecily.

column3:
エリオットの奴、張り切っちゃって
わたしだって負けないから
侵食魔討伐数勝負はわたしのもの！
column4:
Elliot is all fired up, but I won't lose either.
The number of victories in defeating the corrupt
is mine!

column3:
なんだかみんな落ち着いちゃってさ
いいのかな
column4:
It seems like everyone has calmed down. Is it
okay?

column3:
黒騎士は難敵だよね――
闇雲に戦っても勝てないだろうなぁ
column4:
The Black Knight is a formidable opponent, huh? I
don't think you can win by fighting blindly.

column3:
ロイグは、わたしたちが看病したり
治療のために奔走するのが不思議で
たまらないみたい
column4:
Loeg seems to find it fascinating and
irresistible that we take care of him and go all
out for his treatment.

column3: 人の善意に馴れていないんだね
column4: He's not accustomed to people's goodwill.

column3:
もうさ、わたしは戦うの専門でいいかも
腕を磨いて、口出ししないで
ひたすら戦うよ
column4:
Maybe I'll just specialize in fighting
and keep my skills sharp and stay out of the way
I'll just fight.

column3:
黒騎士が来た時、ロイグは勇敢だったよね
見直しちゃったな
column4:
Loeg was brave when the Black Knight came. It
made me reassess him.

column3:
レオを信じる――
うん、わたしはあの人を信じる！
――って、自分に言い聞かせているところ
column4:
I believe in Leo-- Yeah, I believe in that guy!
--I'm just saying to myself.

column3: 隊長、なんだかさ、もう、やるしかないよね！
column4:
Captain, I don't know, I'm just going to have to
do it!

column3:
レオはやっぱりわたしたちのことを考えていて
くれたんだよね
column4: Leo is still thinking about us. He protected us.

column3:
ううん、やっぱり違う
レオが守ったのは
レスタニア全体の未来だよね？
column4:
No, it's different after all. Leo protected the
future of Lestania, right?

column3:
隊長、ほら、遠征？　調査？　散歩？
なんでもいいから、行こうよ
column4:
Captain, hey, expedition? Survey? Walk? Anything
is fine, let's go.

column3:
隊長、レスタニアはどうだった？
問題がないなら、こっちでの任務に専念しない？
column4:
Captain, how was Lestania? If everything is okay,
why don't we just focus on the mission over here?

column3:
このフィンダムって、単純――
ううん、原始的っていうか
洗練されてないっていうか――
column4:
This Phindym, it's simple--
No, it's more like primitive, Not refined--

column3:
ちがうな――ああ、素朴！
この素朴さ、わたしは嫌いじゃないな
column4:
No, it's not - ah, rustic!
I don't mind the simplicity.

column3:
わたしたち、後手後手というか――
遅れちゃってるよね
column4: We're kind of behind the curve...

column3:
ねえ、隊長
急いで、事態の先頭に立とうよ
column4:
Hey captain, hurry up and take the lead in the
situation!

column3:
《原始の雫》を持ち去った犯人は
フィンダムがどうなっても構わない――
やっぱり、幾ら考えても気持がわからないな
column4:
The culprit who took away《Primeval Drops》doesn't
care what happens to Phindym after all— I still
can't understand their feelings no matter how much
I think.

column3: ロイグのしたことは許せないけど――
column4: Loeg's actions are unforgivable, but—

column3:
わたしは憎めないな
フィンダムの人たちはどう裁くつもりなんだろう
column4:
I don't hate. I just wonder how the people of
Phindym are going to judge me.

column3:
なんかさ――
セシリーが、すごく遠い人になっちゃった気がする
column4:
I feel like— Cecily has become a very distant
person.

column3:
でもまあ、仕方ないか
ここはあの子の世界だからね
column4:
But well, I guess there's no helping it. Because
this is her world, you know.

column3:
連戦連戦だからね――
さすがに疲れちゃったかな
column4:
Because it's battle after battle-- I guess I'm
really tired now.

column3:
侵食魔退治でも行く？
あー、こんな気持で戦っちゃ
絶対怪我するよね
column4:
Do you want to go fight the corrupted monsters?
Oh, you shouldn't fight like this, you'll get
injured.

column3:
セシリー、普段と変わらないね
どんな気持ちなのかな――
column4:
Cecily, you're still the same as usual. I wonder
how you feel--

column3:
洞が時々、ふわっと輝くの
まるで何かが始まる予兆みたい
column4:
Sometimes the cave's shining softly, as if it's a
prelude to something starting.

column3:
さあ隊長
どこへでも一緒に行くからね
column4: Alright Captain, I'll go with you wherever you go.

column3:
絶望的な状況に呑み込まれてしまう人と
前を向いて進む人の違いって
なんだろうね？
column4:
What's the difference between someone who gets
swallowed up in a hopeless situation and someone
who moves forward?

column3:
解放軍が明るくなったね
メイロワ将軍効果だね
column4:
The Liberation Army has brightened up. It's the
General Meirova effect.

column3:
王子は身も心も盗賊に染まってしまった――
なんてことはないよね？
column4:
The prince became a bandit in body and soul...
It's not true, right?

column3:
王子は無事なのかな
居場所よりも安否の確認が先だよね
column4:
I wonder if the prince is safe. I'd rather know
if he's safe than where he is.

column3:
王子の目的は恩人の盗賊ベルタを救うこと
その気持ちは大切にしないとね
column4:
The prince's goal is to save his benefactor, the
bandit Bertha. We must cherish that sentiment.

column3:
ネド王子、守ってあげたくなっちゃう
小さな弟がいるのってこんな気分？
column4:
Prince Nedo, I feel like I want to protect you.
Is this what it's like to have a little brother?

column3:
ネド王子は前線に立って兵たちを
鼓舞するのが自分の責務だと
考えているみたい
column4:
Prince Nedo seems to think that it is his duty to
encourage the soldiers on the front line.

column3:
空気が汚れた感じがするよね
オークの攻撃臭が漂ってくるからかな
column4:
The air feels polluted, doesn't it? Maybe it's
because the stench of Orc attacks is lingering in
the air.

column3:
ネド王子、顔がいきいきしてるよ
無理してなければいいけど
column4:
Prince Nedo, your face looks so chipper;
I hope you're not forcing yourself.

column3: 待機はつらいなぁ
column4: Waiting is tough.

column3: 待機はつらいなぁ
column4: Waiting is tough.

column3:
ガルドリンやエリオットと一緒だと
なんだか焦っちゃうんだよね
column4:
When I'm with Gurdolin and Elliot, I somehow get
anxious.

column3:
あの人たち戦闘中はガツガツするから
調子を乱されちゃうんだ
column4:
Those people are too aggressive during combat, so
it throws off my rhythm.

column3:
ネド王子にお礼を言われると
うん、お姉ちゃんもっと頑張るよって
気になるんだよね
column4:
Now that Prince Nedo's thanked me personally, I
feel like I need to redouble my efforts just for
him.

column3: すっかりお姉ちゃん気分
column4: I feel like a big sister now.

column3:
気になることはいろいろあるけれど
先に解放軍の目的を果たさなくちゃね
column4:
There are various things that I am concerned
about, but first, I have to accomplish the
objective of the Liberation Army.

column3:
エリオットとも話したんだ
今は王都の敵に集中しようってね
column4:
I also talked to Elliot. Now let's focus on the
enemies in the Royal Capital.

column3: 隊長――わたし――ううん、なんでもない
column4: Captain - I - no, it's nothing.

column3: だいじょうぶ――だいじょうぶだよ
column4: It's okay... It's okay.

column3: 隊長――わたし、あいつのこと許さないから
column4: Captain - I won't forgive him.

column3:
迷惑かけちゃったよね
この埋め合わせはするから！
column4:
I caused you trouble, didn't I? I will make it up
to you!

column3:
はぁ――もっとわたしたちを
信じてほしいよねえ
column4:
Haa ―― I wish they would believe in us more, you
know

column3:
ネド王子と再会したら
わたし、ちょっとお説教しちゃうかも？
column4:
If I were to meet Prince Nedo again,
I might give him a little sermon.

column3:
王子のことは心配だけど
メイロワ将軍たちに任せておけば
大丈夫だよね
column4:
I'm worried about the prince, but if we leave it
to General Meirova and the others, it should be
fine, right?

column3:
エリオットさあ、大丈夫大丈夫って言い過ぎ！
その方が気になっちゃうじゃない
column4:
Elliot, come on, you say it's okay too much!
You're making me nervous.

column3: ネド王子はいつか竜になるんだよね
column4: Prince Nedo will become a dragon someday.

column3:
どんな感じなのかな
セシリーとは違うのかな
column4:
I wonder what it feels like. How is it different
from Cecily?

column3: なにかお話ししてくださいな
column4: Please tell me something.

column3: うふふ――ご機嫌いかがですか？
column4: How are you feeling?

column3: 内緒話は、ジョゼフおじさまに叱られます
column4:
Uncle Joseph will scold you for talking in
private.

column3:
覚者様は考えたことがありますか？
この世界がどうやって出来たのか――
column4:
Have the Arisen ever thought about it? How was
this world made?

column3:
白竜だけがこの世界の
すべてを知っている――
早くお話しを聞きたいですね
column4:
Only the White Dragon knows everything in this
world--
I want to hear the story quickly.

column3: 覚者になるって、どんな気分ですか？
column4: What does it feel like to become an Arisen?

column3:
戦争って、どんな時代にもありますね
嫌いな人の方が多いはずなのに
column4:
War exists in any era, huh? Even though there
should be more people who hate it.

column3:
みんなでお歌をうたえば戦いがなくなる――
パメラがそう言うんだけど
きっと、そんなに簡単ではないですよね
column4:
If we all sing a song together, there will be no
more fighting--
Pamela says so.
I bet it's not that easy!

column3:
時々、わけもなく悲しくなるの
ううん――わけはあるけど――
話しても誰も戻ってこないから
column4:
Sometimes I feel sad for no reason.
No, I mean, I have my reasons, but...
I talk about it, and no one ever comes back.

column3:
白竜も、人間も、覚者も――魔物だって
同じように生きているんだよね
column4:
Both the White Dragon and humans, as well as the
Arisen, and even enemies, all live in the same
way.

column3:
お友達はいつかいなくなるもの――
それでも、ほしいと思ってしまうの
column4:
Friends are things that eventually disappear ――
But still, you can't help but want them.

column3: この風――あの森にも、吹いているのかな
column4:
I wonder, this wind—Is it blowing in that forest,
too?

column3:
真っ直ぐに進む人は
大切なことを忘れがちです
覚者さん、気をつけてね
column4:
Those who proceed straight ahead tend to forget
important things. Arisen one, be cautious.

column3: 時は――少し、意地悪です
column4: Time is-- harsh.

column3: あれ？　何して遊ぶ？　え？　お話し？
column4: Oh? What should we play? Draw? A story?

column3: こんにちは、メイリーフです
column4: Hello, I'm Mayleaf

column3:
あ、覚えていてくれましたか？
だとしたら、うれしいです！
column4:
Oh, you remember me?
If so, I'm glad!

column3:
あのね――迷惑かけちゃったけど
仲良くしてね？
column4:
Hey, I'm sorry for causing you trouble, but let's
get along, okay?

column3:
わたしはイリスとも仲良しなんだ
だから、イリスが戻ってわたしもうれしいの
column4:
I'm good friends with Iris, so I'm glad she's
back.

column3:
レオが恐い顔をしていたの――
ちょっとびっくりしちゃった
column4:
Leo had a scary look on his face— I was a little
surprised.

column3: 白竜様、元気になーれ！
column4: Who, don't bully—Peco— I won't do bad things.

column3:
わたしはもう絶対にひとりでは神殿から
出ないからね
column4: I will never leave the Temple alone again!

column3:
あなたにもパメラにもジョゼフ様にも
心配をかけちゃって――
column4:
To both you and Pamela and Master Joseph, I
apologize for causing you worry...

column3:
だからこれからは、必ず、誰かと一緒に――
もちろん、みんなが知ってる誰かと一緒に
お出かけすることにして――
column4:
So from now on, I'll be sure to go out with
someone—of course, someone we all know—and—

column3:
しかも、知らない場所へは行かないって
約束するよ！
column4:
And I promise that I won't go to places I don't
know!

column3:
キースヒルト――無事だよね？
ちゃんと逃げるよね？
column4:
Kieshildt--you're safe, right?
You're going to escape, aren't you?

column3: キースヒルト兄様をお願いします
column4: Please take care of Kieshildt.

column3:
――つらいよ
こんなにつらいなんて――
column4:
――This is painful.
How can it be this painful――

column3:
わたしのせいなのかな――
わたしが悪かったのかな――
column4:
Is it my fault--
Was I wrong--?

column3:
わたしはこれからキースヒルトのぶんまで
生きるから――
column4: I'm going to live on, for Kieshildt.

column3:
ううん、死んでしまった人、全員のぶん
わたしは生きるの――そう決めたの
column4:
No, for all those who have died. I'm going to
live - I've decided.

column3:
どこにも行かないで？
誰にもいなくなってほしくないの
column4:
Don't go anywhere. I don't want anyone to
disappear.

column3:
ミシアルとこのあたりを歩いたって本当？
どうしてうちに寄ってくれなかったの！？
column4:
Mysial, is it true that you walked around this
area? Why didn't you come visit me?

column3:
何か怖いことが起こりそうな――
そんな気がするよ？
column4: I feel like something scary is about to happen—

column3:
空気がビリビリ震えているの――
これは良くないことのシルシなの――
column4:
The air is tingling - This is the sign of
something bad -

column3: ねえねえ、イリスはどこにいるの？
column4: Hey, where is Iris?

column3:
わたしを遠くに連れ出したことで
みんな怒っているから教えてくれないの？
column4:
Why won't you tell me? Is it because everyone is
angry with you for taking me far away?

column3:
どうしよう――ミシアルが――
でも、お願い――イリスを怒らないで！
column4:
What should I do―― Mysial――
But, please―― Do not make Iris angry!

column3:
ミシアルみたいに白竜と仲良くなるよ
応援して――ね？
column4:
I'll become friends with the White Dragon like
Mysial.
I hope you support me――okay?

column3:
わたしじゃダメかもしれないけど
それでも応援してね
column4:
I might not be good enough,
but please support me anyway.

column3:
みんな行っちゃうの？
ちゃんと帰ってきてね？
column4:
Are you all leaving?
You'll come back, won't you?

column3: もう、誰もいなくなったら、いやだよ？
column4: I don't want everyone to disappear already.

column3:
力を貸してください――って
白竜様にお祈りしてるの
column4: I'm praying to the White Dragon to help me--

column3: でも、全然起きてくれないの
column4: But they still won't wake up at all.

column3:
がんばれ！
がんばれっ！
column4: Do your best! Do your best!

column3:
おかえりなさい！
ええと、わたしね――ええと――
column4: Welcome back! Um, as for me... um...

column3:
あ、ごめんなさい
わたしじゃなくて、まず、白竜様だよね？
column4:
Oh, I'm sorry. It's not me, but The White Dragon
first, right?

column3: 白竜様も、早く元気になるといいね
column4: I hope The White Dragon gets well soon.

column3:
黒騎士はどこへ行ったの？
行方がわからないなんてこわい！
column4:
Where did The Black Knight go? It's scary not
knowing their whereabouts!

column3: リズ、もう聞こえていないみたい――
column4: Lise, I don't think he can hear me anymore—

column3: 隊長さん、気をつけてね
column4: Captain, be careful.

column3: 全部終わったんだよね？
column4: Is it all finished?

column3:
こわいことや悲しいことは
もう起こらないんだよね？
column4: Scary and sad things won't happen anymore, right?

column3:
いまは戦いに備える時
語り合うのは、またの機会だ
column4:
Now is the time to prepare for battle.
We'll talk about it another time.

column3: 覚者――白竜の力を預かる者か
column4:
Arisen - the one who holds the power of The White
Dragon.

column3:
――？　ああ、失礼
考え事を少々、ね
column4:
――? Ah, excuse me.
Just thinking about something for a moment, hmm.

column3:
そういうえば覚者と話したことは
あまりなかったな――
今度ゆっくり話そうか
column4:
Come to think of it, I didn't have many
conversations with the Arisen—
Shall we talk in detail next time?

column3:
聞きたいことが山ほどある
そんな顔だね
column4:
There are so many things I want to ask. That's
the kind of expression you have.

column3:
僕はどんなふうに見えるんだい？
生を楽しんでいるように見えるかい？
column4:
How do I look?
Do I look like I'm enjoying life?

column3:
気づかなかったが――
きみはいい目をしているな
column4: I hadn't noticed— you have a good eye.

column3:
覚えていてほしい
取るに足りない――なんでもない――
そういうことが実は大きな意味を持っている
それに気づくのはね、大いなる喜びだよ
column4:
Remember, insignificant—nothing—such things
actually mean a great deal. It's a great joy to
realize that, you know?

column3:
つくづく思うよ
世界はね、複雑なんだ
白と黒、善と悪――
そんな単純な区分けはできないのさ
column4:
I really think the world is, you know,
complicated black and white, good and evil--
there's no such simple division.

column3:
人間は興味深いけど
時に、難解すぎる存在だよ
column4:
Humans are interesting but sometimes, they are
too difficult to understand.

column3:
信じる力はとても大切だ
僕も信じているんだ
帰るべき場所――仲間の無事をね
column4:
The power of belief is very important. I believe
in it too. The place I should return to - the
safety of my comrades.

column3:
朝が好きなんだ
幼いころに感じた、あの風の匂いがするからね
column4:
I like mornings, because it reminds me of the
scent of that wind when I was a child.

column3: ああ、君か
column4: Ah, it's you.

column3: 死に急ぐか、若造が
column4: Do you want to hurry up and die, you brat?

column3: 慈悲などやらん、死ね
column4: No mercy, just death.

column3: 木偶どもにはもう飽きたわ
column4: I'm tired of these puppets already.

column3:
わからんな――
お前に勝ち目などない
column4: I don't understand— you don't stand a chance.

column3:
殺し合いの最中に――
笑わせてくれるわ
column4: In the midst of the killing, You make me laugh.

column3:
帰れ――殺すぞ？
おまえは好かん
column4: Go home... or I'll kill you. I don't like you.

column3: まだ盾突くか――ならば、死をくれてやる
column4:
If you still dare to thrust your shield――then
allow me to give you death

column3:
殺す、ただ殺す
それが世界だ
column4: Kill, just kill. That's how the world works.

column3:
気づいているだろうが――
おまえらの死は無駄にはならん
ふははは！
column4:
You may have noticed, but...
Your deaths will not be in vain.
Hahaha!

column3:
その命、よこせ
さあ、よこせ！
column4: Give me that life. Come on, give it to me!

column3: ほう――身の程知らずめ
column4: You fool, know your place.

column3: なんだ？　うまい話でもあるのか？
column4: What's that? You got a better offer?

column3:
オマイと話だと？
ガハハハ、笑わせる！
column4: Talking to me? Gahahahaha, you make me laugh!

column3: 遊びたいが、またな
column4: I'd love to play, but see ya.

column3:
俺サマとトモダチになろうってか？
悪くないな、でも、まあヤメとくよ
column4:
You want to become friends with me? Not bad, but
well, I'll pass.

column3:
オマイ、強いんだろ？
ちょいと、試してやろうか？
column4: You, are you strong? Shall I test you a little?

column3: オマイら、まとめてブッ壊すからな
column4: I'll destroy all of you at once!

column3:
あ？　目的だと？
楽しみは秘密にする主義でな
column4:
What?　You said you wanted to do this?
I like to keep my pleasures a secret.

column3:
暴れたいトキに暴れる
それが人生ってヤツだ
column4:
When you want to go wild, just go wild.
That's what life is all about.

column3:
つまんねえな
ここいらにゃ、弱いヤツらしかいねえのか
column4:
Boring.
Are there only weak people around here?

column3:
アレを、アレして――こうなる！
グフ、グフフフフフ！
column4:
Doing that, it becomes like this! Gufu,
gufufufufu!

column3: なんだよ――オマイ、なんだよ！
column4: What is it - you, what is it!

column3:
巡る竜力を感じます――
やっぱり、心地良いものですね
column4:
I feel the Dragon Force circulating around— After
all, it's a pleasant sensation.

column3: 黒騎士のことを考えていました――
column4: I was thinking about The Black Knight...

column3:
こう見えて、結構戦えるつもりです
必要とあればなんなりと
column4:
Despite my appearance, I am prepared to fight
rather well. If necessary, I am willing to do
whatever it takes.

column3:
みなさんの戦い方はとても洗練されていますね
勉強させてもらいます
column4:
Everyone's way of fighting is very refined, isn't
it? I will learn from it.

column3: みなさんとご一緒できて光栄です
column4: It's an honor to be here with you all.

column3: ご恩はいつかお返しさせていただきます
column4: Yes, I will return the favor someday.

column3:
覚者が一目置かれるのは
みなさんの普段の行いが素晴らしいからですよね
column4:
Arisen are respected because of everyone's
wonderful daily conduct, aren't they?

column3: お疲れじゃないですか？
column4: Are you tired?

column3:
面倒をかけているわたしが言うのも変ですけど――
時々休んでくださいね
column4:
It's strange for someone like me who is causing
trouble to say it, but please take occasional
rests.

column3: はい、なんでしょう
column4: Yes, what is it?

column3:
本当に何から何までお世話になってしまって
お礼の言葉もありません
column4:
I really can't thank you enough for everything
you've done for me.

column3:
わたしにできることがあれば言ってください
戦場でも少しはお役に立てると思います
column4:
Let me know if there is anything I can do for you.
I'm sure I can be of some help on the battlefield.

column3:
わかっています
少し――いいえ、かなり焦っています
column4:
I understand I'm a little bit - no, I'm quite
anxious.

column3:
これ以上、ご迷惑をおかけするのが
心苦しくって――
column4: It pains me to cause you any more trouble.

column3:
ロイグ――
あの人はわたしを知っていましたけど
わたしは――
いくら記憶を探ってもロイグが登場しません
column4:
Loeg ――
That person knew me.
But I ――
No matter how much I search my memory, Loeg does
not appear.

column3:
それほど交わりの薄い人なのでしょうか――
もう一度会えれば――話せれば――
column4:
Is he such a distant person to me - If I could
see him again - If I could talk to him -

column3:
不思議です
不安だし、焦りもあるんですけど
column4: It's strange and I feel uneasy and anxious, but.

column3:
以前とは違って――
みなさんと一緒なら、なんとかなる
そんな風に思えるようになりました
column4:
Unlike before - I feel like I can manage with
everyone.

column3:
ロイグと話せればわたしの記憶は
きっと戻ると思います
column4:
If I can talk to Loeg, I'm sure my memories will
come back.

column3:
待っていてくださいね
きっと――
きっと全部思い出しますから
column4:
Please wait for me. I'm sure—I'll definitely
remember everything.

column3:
もっともっとロイグと話すべきですよね？
それはわかっているんです
でも、もどかしくて――
column4:
I should talk to Loeg more often, right? I know
that but it's frustrating.

column3:
わたしたちは勝利に向かって
確実に進んでいるはずですよね
column4: We are definitely on the road to victory.

column3:
もちろん勝利が全てではありませんけど
未来への道しるべになりますよね？
column4:
Of course, winning isn't everything. But it's a
signpost for the future, right?

column3:
ゲートのことはわたしに任せてください
どんなに時間がかかっても
皆さんを必ずフィンダムにご招待します
column4:
Let me take care of the gate. No matter how long
it takes, I promise to bring you all to Phindym!

column3:
早く集落を目指しましょう
何より、森の中は安全とは言えません
column4:
Let's get to the village as soon as possible.
Above all, it is not safe in the forest!

column3:
隊長、急ぎましょう
ガルドリンさんがいい人なのは知っていますが
誤解を招きやすい性格ですから――
胸騒ぎがします！
column4:
Captain, let's hurry. I know Gurdolin is a good
person, but they have a personality that is easily
misunderstood. I have a feeling of unease!

column3:
状況に流されるだけではなく、抵抗を試みる――
フィンダムではまだ新しい考え方です
column4:
Don't just be swept away by the situation, try to
resist-- It's still a new idea in Phindym!

column3:
協力してくれる人はまだまだ少ないので
わたしが父を探してあげないと――
column4:
Since there are still very few people who are
willing to help, I have to find my father
myself...

column3:
隊長――
父に――父にもしものことがあれば
わたしは――
column4:
Captain -- If something were to happen to my
father -- I...

column3:
すいません、今はこんな個人的な思いは
しまっておくべきですよね
column4:
Sorry, I should probably put these personal
thoughts away for now.

column3:
隊長、父は元気になりますよね？
父の傷は、致命傷ではありませんよね？
column4:
Captain, is Father going to be okay? His wounds
are not fatal, right?

column3:
あと少しですよ、隊長
《原始の雫》が芯なる樹を――
ひいてはこのフィンダムを浄化してくれます
column4:
Left: just a little more, Captain. The "Primeval
Drops" will cleanse the core tree- and in turn,
cleanse Phindym for us.

column3:
その後の美しいフィンダムを
皆さん、ご案内しますからね
column4:
I will show everyone the beautiful Phindym that
comes after that.

column3:
《原始の雫》はわたしの命に替えても守ります
隊長たちは魔物退治に専念してください
column4:
I will protect the《Primeval Drops》 with my life.
Captain, please focus on defeating the enemies.

column3:
このあたりの侵食魔を一掃すれば
次はいよいよ浄化です
もう少し、よろしくお願いします
column4:
If we completely eliminate these corrupting
demons in this area, then it will finally be time
for the purification. A little while longer,
please.

column3:
明るい未来――
夢見ても大丈夫ですよね？
column4: Bright future-- It's okay to dream, right?

column3: 隊長――あと少しだけ、よろしくお願いしますね
column4:
Captain--I'll be counting on you for a few more
minutes.

column3:
おつかれさまです、隊長
俺のやる気、爆発しそうですよ！
column4:
Captain--I'll be counting on you for a few more
minutes.

column3:
隊長、俺を忙しくしてください
ジョゼフ様のところへは戻りたくないんです
column4:
Captain, please keep me busy I don't want to go
back to Master Joseph.

column3:
レスタニアはまた大変なことになりましたけど――
そのおかげで隊長と一緒に働けて――
column4:
Lestania is in trouble again, but— that allowed
me to work with the captain and—

column3: 不謹慎だけど――俺、うれしいです
column4: I know it's inappropriate—but I'm glad I'm here.

column3:
隊長がレオ統率の右腕なら――
俺は隊長の右腕になります！
column4:
If Captain is Leo's right-hand man, I will be
Captain's right-hand man!

column3:
リズと俺――ある意味、敵同士ですよね
どっちが隊長の信頼を勝ち取るか――みたいな
column4:
Lise and me—In a way, we are enemies, aren't we?
It's like, who will earn the captain's trust?

column3:
セシリーはちょっと固いというか――
真面目すぎるんですよね
column4: Cecily is a bit stiff or-- too serious.

column3:
オーク戦争の頃、リズはレスタニアを巡って
お宝とか探してたらしいですね
なんだか、遅れを取った気分です
column4:
I heard that during the orc wars, Lise was
cruising around Lestania looking for treasures and
stuff.
I feel like I'm falling behind!

column3:
侵食魔のせいかな――
少し空気が濁った感じ、しませんか？
column4:
Maybe it's the Corruption?
The air seems a little muddy, don't you think?

column3:
隊長――
やっぱり覚者というのは戦ってこそ、ですよね
つくづく、そう思いますよ
column4:
Captain-- Indeed, it is through battle that an
Arisen truly shows their worth. I am deeply
convinced of this.

column3:
ガルドリンが細々と賭けを持ちかけてくるんですよね
おかげで――いえ、なんでもありません！
column4:
Gurdolin keeps coming up with small bets, you
know. Thanks to that... Well, never mind!

column3:
戦いに慣れてから、時々ですけど、もっと刺激が
ほしいなんて、考えちゃうんですよ
column4:
After getting used to battles, sometimes, I can't
help but think that I want more excitement.

column3: ダメですよね、こういうこと考えちゃ
column4: It's not good, thinking about things like that.

column3:
ガルドリンのこと、いろんな人から聞くんですけど
どうやら最近は丸くなったというか
落ち着いたというか――
column4:
I hear about Gurdolin from various people, and it
seems that recently, they have become more
well-rounded, or rather, calmer.

column3:
最近のことしか知らない俺にしてみれば
これで！？　って感じですけどね
column4:
From my perspective, as someone who only knows
recent things, I have to say... is this it!? But
well, that's how I feel.

column3:
ジョゼフ様から聞く話に隊長が登場するようになって
どれくらい経つか忘れましたけど――
column4:
It has been some time since Captain made their
debut, or so it feels, as I heard from Sir Joseph.
But I can't exactly remember how long ago it was.

column3: 思うに、隊長って、全然変わってないですよね
column4:
In my opinion, the captain hasn't changed at all,
right?
